channel.title: Any tips on making good music?
channel.description: So as I’m still learning how to make good content, I just want to know if there are any tips you can give me to help me make better music.

item.title: Any tips on making good music?
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
There are some helpful videos in this topic, created by the Auxy community

Beat the Clock Special Video Edition Contest & Challenges
Time to Beat the Clock! I’m going on vacation so this edition will be a bit different. Here’s the challenge: Create a tutorial video using the new screen recording feature in iOS 11 (here’s how it works). The theme is “Tips & Tricks”, which means you have to show some trick that you think is useful when making music. Like how to make a good bass line or get your drums to stand out. You can add a voice-over and/or captions if you want. Keep things simple though! Max video length is 5 minutes. U…

item.title: Any tips on making good music?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Step 1: PANIC PANIC PANIC PANIC

For real, the basic way to make good music is to build off of something that sounds good. Make a melody, and then work with that melody to make chords, a bass line and even some drums. It’s how I started. You don’t really need anything more advanced in order to make a good track, especially when starting out. Look at featured tracks in app, or at potential remix stems here on the forum, see what others do, and learn from it. Don’t copy! But learn, understand what they do to make it sound good. This should help ^w^

Read full topic
